Diploma in Nanny Training (DNT) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: The DNT program provides scientific, psychological, and practical training in infant and child-care. This is not basic babysitting, but structured early-childhood development and pediatric first-aid.

  • Duration: 1 Year (2 Semesters)
  • Scope: High overseas demand (Canada, UK, Australia) and elite domestic childcare assignments.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

  • Semester 1: Child Psychology & Development Stages, Pediatric First Aid, Hygiene & Safety.
  • Semester 2: Infant Nutrition & Dietetics, Early Learning & Play Therapy, Special Needs Childcare.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Hands-on: Safe bathing, formula preparation, diapering protocols, CPR for infants, choking interventions (Heimlich).

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Higher Education: BA in Early Childhood Education.
  • Private Sector: Corporate Daycares (KLAY, Amelio), Certified independent Nannies for HNIs.
  • Salary Range: ‚Çπ20,000 - ‚Çπ35,000/month (domestic). Highly lucrative when tied to skilled immigration visas (e.g., Canada Caregiver Pilot).

Diploma in Operation Theatre Technology (DOTT) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: DOTT creates surgical technologists who manage the OT environment, ensuring sterility, preparing surgical instruments, and assisting surgeons directly during operative procedures.

  • Objectives: Mastery of surgical asepsis, instrument handling (scrubbing), and circulating duties.
  • Duration: 2 Years (4 Semesters)

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

  • Semester 1: Anatomy, Surgical Microbiology, CSSD (Central Sterile Services) Protocols.
  • Semester 2: OT Equipment Maintenance (Cautery, Suction, Lithotripsy), Anaesthesia Basics.
  • Semester 3: Surgical Instruments by Specialty (General, Ortho, Neuro, Gynae), Scrubbing Techniques.
  • Semester 4: Practical Clinical Internship (Scrub & Circulating roles).

3Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Hospital Rotations: CSSD, Minor OT, Major OT complexes.
  • Procedures: Surgical hand-washing, gowning/gloving self and surgeon, preparing the Mayo stand, passing instruments anticipatorily.

5Ô∏è‚É£ Internship / Field Training Requirements

  • Requirements: 100 cases scrubbed under supervision (minimum 30 major surgeries).
  • Logbook: Signature required per case specifying role (Scrub Assistant vs Circulating Tech).

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Jobs: Scrub Technician in corporate hospitals, Organ Transplant surgical teams.
  • Certifications: Association of Surgical Technologists (AST) recognized credentials.
  • Salary Range: ‚Çπ18,000 - ‚Çπ30,000/month. Demand is perpetually high.

üéì STUDENT ENGAGEMENT CONTENT

  • Monthly Challenge: "Blind Instrument ID" ‚Äì identifying 50 surgical instruments by touch inside a dark sterile bag.

Diploma in Panchkarma (DP) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: An intensive Ayurveda paramedical course training students to administer the specific bio-purification and bio-cleansing therapies of classical Panchkarma.

  • Duration: 2 Years (4 Semesters)
  • Regulatory: Compliant with NCISM (National Commission for Indian System of Medicine) guidelines for Ayurveda technicians.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

  • Semester 1: Fundamentals of Ayurveda (Dosha, Dhatu, Mala), Rachana Sharira (Anatomy), Dravyaguna (Basic Herbs).
  • Semester 2: Purvakarma (Snehana & Swedana - Oleation & Fomentation techniques).
  • Semester 3: Pradhana Karma (Vamana, Virechana, Basti, Nasya, Raktamokshana) administration.
  • Semester 4: Paschat Karma (Post-therapy diet/Rasayana), Clinical Internship in Ayurveda Hospital.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Hands-on Procedures: Abhyanga (massage) strokes, Shirodhara setup, Basti (enema) preparation using Kashaya (decoction) and Sneha (oil). Pinda Sweda (bolus) preparation.

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Private Sector: Lead Panchkarma Therapist in luxury wellness resorts (Kama Ayurveda, Forest Essentials spas), Ayurvedic hospitals (Kottakkal, Patanjali).
  • Entrepreneurship: Easily scalable into independent therapy centers or home-based Post-Natal Ayurveda care.
  • Salary Range: ‚Çπ15,000 - ‚Çπ25,000/month in hospitals. Wellness resorts pay ‚Çπ35,000+.

Diploma in Radiology & Imaging Technology (DRIT) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: DRIT trains technicians to operate diagnostic imaging equipment (X-Ray, CT, MRI, Ultrasound) safely and effectively to produce high-quality diagnostic images.

  • Objectives: To master radiographic positioning, contrast media administration, and radiation safety physics.
  • Duration: 2 Years (4 Semesters)

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

  • Semester 1: Radiographic Anatomy, Radiation Physics & Hazards, Dark Room Procedures (CR/DR).
  • Semester 2: General Radiography (Bone & Joint positioning), Special Contrast Procedures (Barium, IVU).
  • Semester 3: Modern Imaging Modalities: CT Scan, MRI basics, Ultrasound assisting.
  • Semester 4: Radiation Safety Protocols (AERB), 6-Month Imaging Center Internship.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Subject-Wise Detailed Syllabus

Unit: Radiation Safety Protocols (Sem 4)

  • Topic Breakdown: ALARA principle (As Low As Reasonably Achievable), TLD badge usage, lead apron integrity checks, pregnant patient screening.
  • Competencies: Ensuring AERB compliance in the diagnostic room layout.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Procedures: Positioning patients for tricky views (e.g., Townes, Water's view), setting kVp and mAs appropriately on the console panel, pushing contrast dyes under radiologist supervision.

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Jobs: Radiographer in Trauma Centers, independent MRI/CT console operator.
  • Higher Ed: B.Sc in Medical Imaging Technology.
  • Certifications: Validated handling of radioactive materials (AERB).
  • Salary Range: ‚Çπ20,000 - ‚Çπ35,000/month.

Multipurpose Health Worker (MPHW-Male/Female) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: The MPHW cadre forms the outermost tier of the state health machinery, primarily focused on maternal/child tracking, communicable diseases, and grassroot immunization.

  • Duration: 2 Years
  • Regulatory: Curriculum aligned with Indian Nursing Council (INC) & State Health Directorate standards.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

  • Semester 1: Anatomy, Community Health Nursing, Nutrition.
  • Semester 2: Environmental Sanitation, Communicable Diseases, Infection Control.
  • Semester 3: Midwifery Basics (for Females) / Basic Medical Care (for Males), First Aid.
  • Semester 4: Primary Health Centre (PHC) Internship, Family Welfare Programs, Health Data Recording.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Field Skills: Taking vitals, administering IM/Sub-Q vaccines (Pulse Polio, Mission Indradhanush), maintaining cold chain for vaccines.

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Government Jobs: Sub-Center Incharge, ANM/MPHW under National Health Mission (NHM). Huge government recruitment drives exist for this specific diploma.
  • Salary Range: ‚Çπ18,000 - ‚Çπ28,000/month (Govt block).
